comments:
Eclipse 3.0.1 will not even start on my machine, due to 'running out of
handles'.  I've seen other bugs reported for this (mainly on Windows platforms)
which are similar, but not identical.  In the other bugs reported people have
been able to work around this issue by closing the number of windows they have
open, but for me Eclipse doesn't get as far as opening the main window!

The log produced is as follows:

!SESSION Dec 20, 2004 17:15:31.30 ----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=M200409161125
java.version=1.4.2_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -configuration

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Dec 20, 2004 17:15:31.31
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2717)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2616)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2587)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.createDisplay(Display.java:709)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.create(Display.java:694)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.<init>(Device.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:402)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<init>(Display.java:398)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createDisplay(Workbench.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createDisplay(PlatformUI.java:153)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.createDisplay(IDEApplication.java:122)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:72)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:335)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:273)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:129)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:185)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:704)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:688)

I am not running any other java applications, and I am using the Sun 1.4.2_06
Java implementation.  The Eclipse splash screen appears on my PC and just hangs
there until I kill the relevant process.  Would it not be possible to have
Eclipse handle the 'out of handles' error with a dialog box and a close down?

For some reason gtk_init_check() is failing.  BB to investigate.  In any case, 
I have changed the error message to be better.

Eclipse 3.1 will start for me, but locks up randomly within two minutes of
starting.  As I'm sure you can imagine this is making Eclipse unusable for me,
I'm slightly concerned by how flaky Eclipse appears, Is there a new release on
the horizon with the emphasis on bug-fixes rather than additional features?

Mark, your problem sounds very strange.  Eclipse should not be hanging or
returning errors like this.  I have never seen this problem.

Can you tell me more about your system?
  - What Linux distribution are you using?
  - What version of GTK+2 and pango does it ship with?
  - What window manager / desktop environment do you use?

Hi Billy,

I built my Linux system from scratch using (surprise) Linux From Scratch 5.0. 
The kernel has since been updated to 2.6.9.  I'm running Gnome 2.8.2, which is
using:

GTK+ 2.4.14
Pango 1.6.0

All of the relevant libraries are contained in /usr/gnome-2.8.2/lib which has
been added to /etc/ld.so.conf

I have checked for obsolete versions of these libraries in /usr/lib and there
are none there to cause any conflicts.  Is there any way of providing you with
more verbose debug/diagnostic output?

Are you still seeing hangs with 3.1M4?  Can you grab this app, run it, and post
here the output:

  http://vektor.ca/bugs/gtkinfo.c

(the compile line is at the top of the file)

No response on this bug.  In 3.1, we now note in the log if gtk_init_check() is
failing so it should help get better information if you try there.  Please
re-open this bug if you have more information about your setup and are still
experiencing problems.
